CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage.

Let's think step by step.
1. SiO2: This is the material name of the gate dielectric layer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Paragraph: The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source-drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2. The material name for the gate dielectric layer is SiO2.

Let's think step by step.

Paragraph: The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage.

Let's think step by step.

1. Hole mobility (μ): This is the property value being estimated in the paragraph.
2. Channel width (W): This is a property of the channel that is used in the calculation of mobility.
3. Channel length (L): This is another property of the channel that is used in the calculation of mobility.
4. Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer (Ci): This is a property of the gate dielectric layer.
5. Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer value (7.5 nF / cm^2): This is a specific value of the property "capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer".
6. Threshold voltage (V T): This is a property of the MOSFET device.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Hole mobility (μ): This is the property value being estimated.
2. Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer value (7.5 nF / cm^2): This is a specific value of a material property.
